docs.title: Welcome to In A Nutshell
docs.text: In a nutshell, this project provides a way to streamline Linux and macOS setup with useful scripts and configurations.

docs.title: Project Overview
docs.text: This repository contains scripts, configurations, and aliases to make setting up and using Linux and macOS environments easier.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• Git aliases and configurations
  • Zsh aliases and setup scripts
  • Utility scripts for common tasks
  • Docker setup scripts
  • Clean installation guides

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
Check out the appropriate section for your operating system:

  • MacOS Setup

docs.text:
You must have Homebrew installed 

/bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/HEAD/install.sh)"

docs.title: Git Configuration
docs.text: This section covers the Git configurations and aliases included in this repository.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The Git configuration in this repository provides a set of useful aliases and settings to improve your Git workflow.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
To use the Git configuration:

  1. Copy the .gitconfig file to your home directory or include it in your existing Git configuration:
cp _git_/.gitconfig ~/.gitconfig
  1. Customize the user section with your own information:
git config --global user.email "your.email@example.com"
git config --global user.name "Your Name"

docs.title: Node.js & npm Installation Guide
docs.text: This guide provides steps for clean installation of Node.js and npm on different operating systems.

docs.title: WSL Ubuntu
docs.text:
1. Remove the installed Node.js package: 

    sudo apt-get remove nodejs

  2. Remove the installed npm package: 

    sudo apt-get remove npm

  3. Remove Node.js directories: 

    sudo rm -rf /usr/local/lib/nodejs
sudo rm -rf ~/.npm

  4. Check if Node.js and npm are uninstalled: 

    node -v
npm -v

  5. If Node.js is still present, find and remove it: 

    which npm

docs.title: Windows System
docs.text:
1. Open the Start Menu and search for "Add or Remove Programs"
  2. Find Node.js in the list and click on it
  3. Click on the "Uninstall" button

docs.title: Installing Node.js and npm using nvm
docs.text:
This is the recommended approach for all platforms:

  1. Install nvm: 

    curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nvm-sh/nvm/v0.38.0/install.sh | zsh

  2. Activate nvm: 

    source ~/.zshrc

  3. Install Node.js and npm: 

    nvm install node

  4. Verify the installation: 

    node -v
npm -v

docs.title: Fixing Permission Issues on macOS
docs.text:
If you encounter permission errors when running npm:

  1. Add npm directory to PATH: 

    nano ~/.bash_profile

  2. Add this line: 

    export PATH="$HOME/.npm-packages/bin:$PATH"

  3. Save the file and verify: 

    cat .bash_profile

  4. Optional: Add nvm configuration: 

    export NVM_DIR=~/.nvm
[ -s "$NVM_DIR/nvm.sh" ] && . "$NVM_DIR/nvm.sh"

  5. Update your environment: 

    source ~/.bash_profile
source ~/.bashrc
source ~/.zshrc

docs.title: Ubuntu Scripts
docs.text: This section covers scripts specific to Ubuntu environments.

docs.title: docker-setup.sh
docs.text:
The docker-setup.sh script automates the installation of Docker on Ubuntu and WSL2.

View Script Source

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: ./scripts/ubuntu/docker-setup.sh

docs.title: What It Does
docs.text:
1. Updates package lists
  2. Installs curl if not present
  3. Adds Docker repository to APT sources
  4. Installs Docker and Docker Compose
  5. Adds the current user to the docker group
  6. Starts the Docker service

docs.title: Reference
docs.text: This script is based on documentation from: - Docker's official installation guide - Docker on WSL2

The fzadd.sh script provides a fuzzy finder interface for Git staging operations.

docs.text:

  • Fallback to manual selection if fzf is not available
  • Preview of diffs for each file
  • Multi-select functionality

docs.title: Oh My Zsh Setup
docs.text: This page covers the setup and configuration of Oh My Zsh included in this repository.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
You can install Oh My Zsh using the provided script:

./_zsh_/omz-init.sh

View Installation Script Source

This script will:

  1. Update package lists
  2. Install essential packages
  3. Install curl, wget, git, and zsh
  4. Install git-core, curl, and fonts-powerline
  5. Install Oh My Zsh
  6. Install Powerlevel10k theme

docs.title: Powerlevel10k Theme
docs.text:
The script sets up the Powerlevel10k theme, which provides a highly customizable prompt with many features.

After installation, you need to:

  1. Open your ~/.zshrc file
  2. Find the line that sets ZSH_THEME
  3. Change its value to powerlevel10k/powerlevel10k

The first time you open a new terminal after this change, the Powerlevel10k configuration wizard will run automatically.

docs.title: Customization
docs.text:
For further customization of your Oh My Zsh setup, you can:

  1. Install additional plugins by adding them to the plugins=() array in your ~/.zshrc
  2. Add custom aliases to your ~/.zsh-alias.sh file
  3. Sync your aliases using the sync-zsh-alias.sh script

View Aliases Sync Script Source
